pullrequest.title: Camera intrinsics - conversion of y principal point from OpenCV to OpenGL

content.html:
thanks again for the contribution!

The Y inversion change sounds good to me. As for the function name change, we adopt a tick-tock deprecation approach to API changes (see Migration guide). So we need to keep the original BuildProjectiveMatrix function but mark it as deprecated, and its implementation will just call the new BuildProjectionMatrix function, e.g. in Camera.hh

      public: static ignition::math::Matrix4d BuildProjectiveMatrix(...)
               GAZEBO_DEPRECATED(11.0);

and in Camera.cc:

ignition::math::Matrix4d Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix(...)
{
  return Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix(...);
}

FYI, I’ve backported the camera intrinsics changes to gazebo 9 in pull request #3099

pullrequest.title: Camera intrinsics - conversion of y principal point from OpenCV to OpenGL

content.raw:
Thank you for your feedback!  
As requested, I added the `BuildProjectiveMatrix` deprecation and also made minor improvements to the documentation.

For future reference, I discussed the modeling of camera intrinsics in opengl in this paper:

“Modeling of video projectors in OpenGL for implementing a spatial augmented reality teaching system for assembly operations”

[https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332083524\_Modeling\_of\_video\_projectors\_in\_OpenGL\_for\_implementing\_a\_spatial\_augmented\_reality\_teaching\_system\_for\_assembly\_operations](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332083524_Modeling_of_video_projectors_in_OpenGL_for_implementing_a_spatial_augmented_reality_teaching_system_for_assembly_operations)
content.html:

pullrequest.title: Camera intrinsics - conversion of y principal point from OpenCV to OpenGL

content.raw: I think we have not merge forward the changes yet, e.g. I see in `gazebo9` branch that the variable names have been renamed to projection but in `default` they are still projective.
content.html: I think we have not merge forward the changes yet, e.g. I see in gazebo9 branch that the variable names have been renamed to projection but in default they are still projective.

pullrequest.title: Camera intrinsics - conversion of y principal point from OpenCV to OpenGL

content.raw: it got merged to gazebo10 in pr #3117 and then to default in cf248d4, but I guess we haven't changed the variable names on default
content.html: it got merged to gazebo10 in pr #3117 and then to default in cf248d4, but I guess we haven't changed the variable names on default

pullrequest.title: Camera intrinsics - conversion of y principal point from OpenCV to OpenGL

content.raw: after revisiting this PR, I think the important changes \(principal point y inversion\) have already been captured in the `default` branch \(when it was backported and merged forward\). The only difference between this branch and `default` is the renaming of the protected variable from `cameraProjectiveMatrix` to `cameraProjectionMatrix`. I’m tempted to leave it as is since I don’t think we’re deparecating any more? In that case, we should be able to just close this PR.
content.html: after revisiting this PR, I think the important changes (principal point y inversion) have already been captured in the default branch (when it was backported and merged forward). The only difference between this branch and default is the renaming of the protected variable from cameraProjectiveMatrix to cameraProjectionMatrix. I’m tempted to leave it as is since I don’t think we’re deparecating any more? In that case, we should be able to just close this PR.

pullrequest.title: Camera intrinsics - conversion of y principal point from OpenCV to OpenGL

content.raw: +1, there won't be a Gazebo 12, so we don't need to deprecate things on Gazebo 11. I'll close this.
content.html: +1, there won't be a Gazebo 12, so we don't need to deprecate things on Gazebo 11. I'll close this.
